intro: Crotalaria pterocalyx, commonly known as the winged crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive, winged seed pods. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with pinnately compound leaves and produces yellow or orange flowers. Its botanical features include erect stems, trifoliate leaves, and showy, butterfly-shaped flowers that attract pollinators. Crotalaria pterocalyx is also notable for its potential medicinal properties and use in traditional herbal remedies.
